did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Audio Recordings, Computer Media, Correspondence, Memorabilia, Newspapers, Photographs, Publications, Scrapbooks
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Material documenting the history of the Cornell University Big Red Marching Band, including print and audio visual items.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: "Big Red Band Notes," newsletter; "Through the Years with the Big Red Band," 1990; clippings; t-shirts, 1983, 2001-2003; and alumni visor hat. Also, movie films of band shows from the late 1940s through the late 1950s. 16mm motion picture films of the Cornell Big Red Band in color and black and white. Includes footage of the bannd at Niagara, Princeton, Columbia 1948; University of Pennsylvania, n.d.; Presidential Review, 20 May, 1954; Coumbia 1 November 1958; Penn. crew formation. Other reels are unidentified.
Includes files, photographs, scrapbooks, and recordings.

descgrp.head: INFORMATION FOR USERS

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Big Red Band miscellany, #37-6-3112. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

descgrp.p: See also Cornell University football motion pictures movies, videos, and film, #40-2-2205

scopecontent.p: Features the band playing fight songs from Cornell, Army, boston college, Boston University, Brown, Bucknell, Columbia, Colgate, Dartmouth, Harvard, Holy Cross, Navy, Penn State, Pennsylvania University, Princeton, Pittsburgh, Rutgers, Syracuse, Temple, Vermont, Villanova, West Virginia and Yale.

Film can and leader is labeled Cornell Band Roll. 1 Niagara, Princeton, Columbia, reel itself is labeled 1937 Syracuse, Colgate, Columbia, but may be a reused reel.
Label on can says early before 1953? band day. Reel itself says "This is Cornell" R-1. Footage is in color.

scopecontent.p: Use DVD-764. includes footage of Bill the Goat the live Navy mascot and also Touchdown the Cornell bear costumed human in addition to the band formations. May include footage from other games as well.

did.unittitle: Unknown game at Cornell, date based on formation spelling out 1956. Footage shows the opposing team's band performance as well as Cornell's. Color.
Princeton at Cornell, includes card listing formations, also labeled as Fall Weekend 1958-59, Lionel Hampton, Dad's Day
